page.title: 14CHURCH HISTORY AND LEGEND
page.content: In All Saints Church chancel is a stone statue of a knight. He is William De Marmion who died in 1270 and whose family were Lords of the Manor of Winteringham from 1166_1325. He is dressed in chain armour with a shield. His feet are resting on a lion and his head is guarded by two angels. Behind the font is a stained glass window in memory of Henry Kirk_White a famous Nottinghamshire poet and pupil at the vicarage from 1804_5. Local legend says that whilst crossing the river his boat became stuck on a mud bank. It was then that he wrote the words of the famous hymn "Oft in danger, oft in woe". The church shares a vicar with three neighbouring villages. A Communion service is held each Sunday at 9am and Evensong is held every third Sunday in the month.
